data.title: Housing and Redevelopment Authority (HRA)
data.meta_description: The Housing and Redevelopment Authority is a structure for real estate, housing and commercial loans, grants, and issuance of bonds.
data.text:
About the HRA

The Housing and Redevelopment Authority of the City of Saint Paul, Minnesota (HRA) is a legally distinct public entity which undertakes housing, commercial and business development activities. The HRA authorizes the acquisition of real estate, housing and commercial loans and grants and the issuance of bonds.

HRA Policies

When receiving funding from the City of Saint Paul and/or the Housing and Redevelopment Authority (HRA), one or more compliance components may be required. To determine what applies to your project, contact your PED project manager.

Disposition Policy – Policy for conveyance of HRA-owned real estate

Short Term Temporary Use – Policy for temporary use of HRA-owned properties (up to thirty days)

Garden Lease Guidelines – Policy for use of HRA real estate for gardens

Guidelines for Disposition of Splinter Parcels – Policy for the conveyance of HRA-owned unbuildable parcels

Two Bid Requirement Policy - Policy requiring two written bids for construction work by all recipients of HRA and Conduit Organizations Contracts

Limited English Proficiency (LEP) Language Access Plan - For more information on the current LEP Plan, please email Crystal King

Early Notification System Bulletins

City agencies and meeting bodies use the Early Notification System (ENS) to inform neighborhood organizations and concerned citizens of all considered, and proposed, planned or implemented developments, legislative and policy changes and enforcement actions that may potentially impact the neighborhood and/or area residents.

Subscribe to all ENS notifications
